· 11 · 30a
Seint Dun&slong;ton wa&slong; of enguelonde Enguelonde &punctelev; icome of guode mo&rrot;e
Miracle o&rrot;e louerd dude fo&rrot; him &punctelev; þe &yogh;uyt he was unbo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þo he wa&slong; in his moder wombe &punctelev; In in a candelma&slong;&slong;e day
Þat folk wa&slong; muche at churche &punctelev; a&slong;e hit to þe tyme lay
A&slong; huy &slong;toden alle with heo&rrot;e li&yogh;t &punctelev; ri&yogh;t al&slong;o men &slong;tondeth &yogh;uiyt nou
heo&rrot;e li&yogh;t queincte oueral &punctelev; þat no mon nu&slong;te hou
here þat li&yogh;t barnde &slong;wiþe wel &punctelev; and here it wa&slong; al oute
Þat folk &slong;tod al in gret wonder &punctelev; and weren in grete doute
And bispeken ech to oþur &punctelev; in &yogh;wuche man&combtildevert;e manere it were
Þat it queinte &slong;o &slong;odeinliche &punctelev; al þat li&yogh;t þat huy bere
Al&slong;o huy &slong;toden and þarof &slong;peken &punctelev; in gret wonder echon
Seint Dun&slong;tone&slong; moder taper &punctelev; afuyre werth anon
Þat heo huld in hire hond &punctelev; heo nu&slong;te &yogh;wanne&slong; it cam
Þat folk &slong;tod and þat bihuld &punctelev; and gret wonder þarof it nam
No man nu&slong;te fro whanne&slong; it cam &punctelev; bote þo&rrot;u o&rrot;e louerdes gce grace
Þarof huy tenden alle heo&rrot;e li&yogh;t &punctelev; þat weren in þe place
&YOGH;wat wa&slong; þat þat o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; fram heouene þat li&yogh;t &slong;ende
And þat folk þat þare &slong;tode aboute &punctelev; heo&rrot;e taperes þarof tende
Bote þat of þulke holi∧ child &punctelev; þat wa&slong; in hire wombe þere
Al
enguelond Enguelond &slong;cholde beo ili&yogh;t &punctelev; bet þane hit euer er were
Þo þi&slong; child wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; his freond nomen þerto hede
huy leten hit do to Gla&slong;tingburi &punctelev; to no&rrot;i&slong;chci and to fede
And to techen him his bileue al&slong;o &punctelev; his pater no&slong;ter and crede
Þat child wax and wel iþev&yogh; &punctelev; a&slong;e it mo&slong;te nede
To þe wo&rrot;ld he nam luyte &yogh;eme &punctelev; fo&rrot; to alle godne&slong;&slong;e he d&rrot;ou&yogh;
Ech man þat heo&rrot;de of him &slong;peke &punctelev; hadde of him ioye inov&yogh;
Þo he couþe manne&slong; wit &punctelev; to his vncle he gan go
Þe Erchebi&slong;chop of
caunterburi Caunterburi &punctelev; Aldelm þat wa&slong; þo
With him he maude ioye inov&yogh; &punctelev; and euere þe leng þe mo&rrot;e
Þo he i&slong;ei of his guodne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; and of his wi&slong;e lo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; gret deinte deinté þat he hadde of him &punctelev; he dude him &slong;one b&rrot;ingue
To þe p&rrot;ince of Engelond &punctelev; Aþel&slong;ton þe kyngue
Þe king him maude ioye inou&yogh; &punctelev; and g&rabar;untede grauntede al his bone
Of &yogh;wat þing þat he wolde him bidde &punctelev; &yogh;if it were to done
Seint Dun&slong;ton him bad ane place &punctelev; þare he wa&slong; fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t
In þe toun of Gla&slong;tingburi &punctelev; þat he ne wernde him nou&yogh;t
Þe king g&rabar;untede grauntede him is bone anon &punctelev; and after him al&slong;o
Edmund is b&rrot;oþer þo he wa&slong; king &punctelev; and in his power ido
To Gla&slong;tingburi he wende &slong;one &punctelev; þe guode man &slong;eint Seint Dun&slong;ton
Þo boþe þe kingue&slong; &yogh;eue him leue &punctelev; Eadmund and Athel&slong;ton
A fair Abbeye abbeye he let þare arere &punctelev; a&slong;e men i&slong;eoth þare &yogh;uyt &slong;tonde
Of blake Moneke&slong; monekes þat wa&slong; arerd &punctelev; þe fur&slong;te of Enguelonde
Fo&rrot; ech Abbeie abbeie of Enguelonde &punctelev; þat of blake Moneke&slong; monekes is
Of þe hou&slong; of Gla&slong;tingburi &punctelev; fur&slong;t sp&rrot;ong and cam iwis
Him&slong;ulf he nam þe Abite abite þere &punctelev; and Monek monek fo&rrot;me&slong;t bicam
Sone he wa&slong; Abbot abbot of þe hous &punctelev; and gret couent to him nam
he makede þare gode&slong; Godes &slong;erui&slong;e &punctelev; &slong;tudefa&slong;t and &slong;table inov&yogh;
Þat couent þat þareinne was &punctelev; to alle guodne&slong;&slong;e d&rrot;ou&yogh;
Þis holi Abbod abbod
seint Seint Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; hadde gret power
With þe king King
Eadmund þo he wa&slong; king &punctelev; he wa&slong; is con&slong;eiller
After þe king King
Eadmunde&slong; deþe &punctelev; a guode &yogh;wyle it wa&slong; agon
Þat Edwyne is &slong;one wa&slong; king imaud &punctelev; ake nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t &slong;one after anon
¶ Þis Edwyne hadde ful vuel red &punctelev; and þareaftur he d&rrot;ov&yogh;
With seint Seint Dun&slong;ton he wa&slong; wroth &punctelev; and with wel gret wov&yogh;
Of his Abbeye abbeye he d&rrot;of him out &punctelev; and dude him &slong;chame inov&yogh;
Þe mo&rrot;e &slong;chame þat he him dude &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e þe guode man lov&yogh;
he let d&rrot;iue him out of Enguelonde &punctelev; and let crien him fleme
Þis guode man wende out wel glad &punctelev; ne tok he none &yogh;eme
To þe Abbeie abbeie of seint Seint Amaunt &punctelev; bi&yogh;eonde se he d&rrot;ou&yogh;
And &slong;o&rrot;io&rrot;nede þare longue &punctelev; and ladde guod lijf inov&yogh;
¶ þo þe king King Edwyne wa&slong; ded &punctelev; Edgar þat wa&slong; is b&rrot;oþer
· 11 ·
After him wa&slong; king Imaud &punctelev; fo&rrot; he wa&slong; ner þane ani oþur
Swyþe guod man he bicam &punctelev; and louede wel holi churche
And ech man þat him to guode radde &punctelev; aftur him he gan wurche
¶ Men tolden him of seint Seint
Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; þat is b&rrot;oþer d&rrot;of out of londe
With vnri&yogh;tht fo&rrot; is guodne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; and he bigan him vnder&slong;tonde
After him he &slong;ende anon &punctelev; þat he come a&yogh;en sone
And with him bileue is con&slong;eiler &punctelev; of þat he hadde to done
Seint Dun&slong;ton cam hom a&yogh;en &punctelev; and faire wa&slong; vnderfongue
And hadde his Abbeye abbeye al in pays &punctelev; fram &yogh;wuche he hadde ibeo longue
Swyþe wel he wa&slong; with þe king &punctelev; and al his con&slong;eiller
Men &slong;peken muche of his guodne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; wel wide feo&rrot; and ner
HIt Hit bifel þat þe Bi&slong;chop &punctelev; of wy&rrot;ece&slong;tre Wyrecestre wa&slong; ded
Þe kyng and þe Erchebi&slong;chop Eode &punctelev; þarof nomen heo&rrot;e red
And þene holie Abbod abbod
&slong;eint Seint
Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; Bi&slong;chop bischop huy maden þere
Fo&rrot; he &slong;cholde beo herre in gode&slong; Godes lawe &punctelev; þei it a&yogh;ein is wille were
Some men axeden at þe Erchebi&slong;chope &punctelev; of Caunterburi
sire Sire
Ode
&YOGH;warefo&rrot;e þat he him Bi&slong;chop bischop maude &punctelev; and &yogh;wy his g&rabar;ce&slong; graces weren &slong;o guode
Fo&rrot; he &slong;chal &slong;eide þis guode Man man &punctelev; aftur me here bee
Erchebi&slong;chop of Caunterburi &punctelev; and þat Men men &slong;chullen isee
&YOGH;wat wo&slong;tþou þis oþere &slong;eiden &punctelev; þou &slong;pext folliche iwis
Þou no&slong;t non mo&rrot;e þane þi fot &punctelev; opon god God al it is
Mine leue frend &slong;eide þis holie Man man &punctelev; &yogh;e ne do&rrot;re me blamie nou&yogh;t
Fo&rrot; ich wot wel &yogh;wat o&rrot; louerd c&combtildevert;&slong;t Crist &punctelev; in mi Mouth mouth hath ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t
And ho&slong;o with&slong;eith ou&yogh;t of þulke þinge &punctelev; þat ich eov habbe i&slong;ed
Þe soþe he mai &slong;eo &yogh;if he liueth &punctelev; after þat ich am ded
b
BI&slong;chop Bischop he wa&slong; of londone Londone &punctelev; seint Seint Dun&slong;ton &slong;ethþe al&slong;o The littera notabilior "B" is poorly formed and only pointed red to the left in the margin is what looks like small "b". It seems likely that the marginal notation was added afterwards because of the illegibility of the capital letter.
Of londone Londone and of wy&rrot;ece&slong;tre Wyrecestre &punctelev; and heold boþe to
hit bifel þat þe Erchebi&slong;chop &punctelev; of Caunterburi wa&slong; ded
Þe pope Pope and þe king Edgar &punctelev; þarof nomen heo&rrot;e red
And mauden þane guode man
seint Seint
Dun&slong;ton an &punctelev; Erchebi&slong;chop erchebischop þere
Guode men þat him iknewen &punctelev; wel glade þarof were
Þe cri&slong;tindom Cristindom of Enguelonde &punctelev; to guod &slong;tat he d&rrot;ov&yogh;
And þe ri&yogh;te&slong; of holi churche &punctelev; he heold up fa&slong;te inov&yogh;
he fourmede þo&rrot;u&yogh; al enguelond Enguelond &punctelev; þat ech per&slong;on &slong;cholde cheo&slong;e
To witien him cha&slong;te fram lecherie &punctelev; oþur his churche leo&slong;e
Seint Athelwold wa&slong; þulke tyme &punctelev; Bi&slong;chop of winche&slong;tre Winchestre
And O&slong;wold þe guode man &punctelev; Bi&slong;chop of wurece&slong;tre Wurecestre
Þeos twei Bi&slong;chope&slong; bischopes with seint Seint
Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; weren al at one rede
And Edgar þe guode king &punctelev; to done þat guode dede
Þeos þ&rrot;eo Bi&slong;chope&slong; bischopes wenden aboute &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; al Enguelonde
And euerech luþer &pbardes;&slong;on person ca&slong;ten out &punctelev; heom ne mi&yogh;hte non at&slong;tonde
heo&rrot;e churchene and heo&rrot;e oþer guod &punctelev; clanliche heom binome
And bi&slong;etten as on guode men &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; þe pope&slong; graunt of rome Rome
Ey&yogh;hte an fourti Abbeie&slong; abbeies &punctelev; of Monekes monekes and of nonne&slong;
Of þat tre&slong;ur huy arerden in Enguelonde &punctelev; þat of per&slong;ones wa&slong; &slong;o iwonne
[ffo&rrot; so hit was bet biset &punctelev; þen hit were[al. was] er on schrewe
ffor whonne gode May&slong;tres maystres beoþ &punctelev; sum goodnesse heo wolleþ schewe
Gode weoren þe þreo Bisschopes bisschopes &punctelev; þat þulke tyme weren þo
Þe betere hit is in Engelonde &punctelev; fo&rrot; hem eueremo
¶ Vr lord &yogh;af seint Seint Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; on eorþe so feir grace
Þat on a tyme as he was &punctelev; in a p&rrot;iue place
his ffader and his Modur modur ek &punctelev; in þe Ioye ioye of heuene anheih
Aftur þat heo weoren dede &punctelev; wel aperteliche he hem seih
Gret loue vr lord him kudde &punctelev; whon he him schewede þere
So muche of his p&rrot;iuyte &punctelev; þe while he alyue were
¶ As he lay a noþur time &punctelev; in his re&slong;te a niht
he sayh þe Ioye ioye of heuene &punctelev; and þe place þerinne wel b&rrot;iht
Aungels he herde syngen also &punctelev; a Murie murie song þerInne þerinne
Þat me syngeþ in holy Holy Chirche &punctelev; whon me þe Masse masse biginne
Kyrie leyson xpe leyson &punctelev; was þat Murie murie song
Þe holi Mon mon þat þis iherde &punctelev; hit ne þhouhte him noþing long
¶ Wel ouhte he to heuene come &punctelev; at his endeday
&YOGH;wile he was alyue &punctelev; so muche of heuene he say Horstmann gives the first word as 'þat;", presumably based on the reading in the Vernon MS. However, the first word of the line is clearly a &yogh;, making it likely that the first word in the Laud MS. is "&yogh;wile".
harpe he louede swiþe wel &punctelev; fo&rrot; of harpe he couþe inouh
A day he sat in his solas &punctelev; and a lay þeron he drouh
Þe harpe he heng vp bi þe wouh &punctelev; þo hit was tyme to ete
Þo hit was redi þerto ib&rrot;ouht &punctelev; he sat doun to his mete
Of heuene he gon þenche sone &punctelev; of ioye þat was þere
O n f þe Ioyful ioyful blisse þat þer was &punctelev; among halewen þat þer were
he sat as þei&yogh; he weore inome &punctelev; so muche þeron he þouhte.
his harpe þat heng so bi þe wouh &punctelev; of whom he luyte RouhteThe second letter of "harpe" looks like an "e".
heo gan to kuiþe his holy þouht &punctelev; ded treo þei&yogh; hit were
Also it o&rrot; ore lordus wille was— &punctelev; hire herden alle þat weoren þere.
Al bi hireself heo gon harpen &punctelev; a Murie Antempne iwis
Þat men singeþ &yogh;ut in holy churche &punctelev; þat on Englisch is þis
halewene soulen glade beoþ &punctelev; þat in heuene beoþ ido
Þat siweden vr lordes wey &punctelev; and for him schedden also
heo&rrot;e blod fo&rrot; his swete loue &punctelev; þerfore heo schulen wone
And kyngues bee wiþouten ende &punctelev; wiþ crist Crist Godus sone
Þe Antenene þat murie is &punctelev; as þis folk iherden alle
Þe harpe song al bi hireself &punctelev; as heo heng bi þe walle
Faire grace o&rrot;e lord him schewede þer &punctelev; whon þat dede treoThis line and the next are missing from the Vernon MS, so Horstmann takes them from the Harley MS.
Scholde so singue of þulke Ioye &punctelev; þat he scholde Inne beo
Louerd ihered beo þi grace &punctelev; & þi mi&yogh;te also
Þat wolde&slong;t fo&rrot; her
alyue for him &punctelev; such miracle do
þo þis holie man hedde ilyued &punctelev; on eorþe mony a day
And his endedai was neih icome &punctelev; as he himself say&yogh;
An holi þo&rrot;re&slong;dai he wex sek &punctelev; as hit fel in þe &yogh;ere
he liet him clepe of his frendes &punctelev; þat specials to hym were
his men þat him serueden ek &punctelev; he lette hem clepe also
All the rest of the vita is taken from the Vernon MS.
And for&yogh;af hem heore trespas &punctelev; þat heo him hedden misdo
And asoylede hem of heore sunnes &punctelev; as he in Godus bendes lay
And so he lay in þulke tyme &punctelev; and eke þene ffriday
he lette clepe þe saturday &punctelev; þe ffreres bifo&rrot;en him alle
And bad hem alle haue god day &punctelev; and seide what him hem scholde bifalle
he let him don al his Rihtes &punctelev; and vr lordus flesch he nom
And wende out of þis world &punctelev; and to heuene wel sone com
Now swete lord seint Seint Dun&slong;ton &punctelev; þat vre Erchebisschop erchebisschop were
Bring vs to þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; as Angles angles þi soule bere. Amen
